premise_source_doc_sentence: The Academy Honorary Award -- instituted in 1948 for the 21st Academy Awards  (  previously called the Special Award , which was first presented in early 1929  )  -- is given annually by the Board of Governors of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences  (  AMPAS  )  to celebrate motion picture achievements that are not covered by existing Academy Awards , although prior winners of competitive Academy Awards are not excluded from receiving the Honorary Award .
